answerText: Hartree-Fock method[10] The Hartree-Fock method is used to find the wavefunction of a many body system in this state, which for the quantum harmonic oscillator corresponds to the zero-point energy. This state contrasts with excited states.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Penn | 13 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The Pople-Nesbitt-Berthier equations are the basis for the unrestricted variant of this method, which can allow for different numbers of electrons in each spin. For 10 points each: [10] Name this self-consistent field method used to find solutions to the Schrodinger equation for a many-atom molecule.
